remarks: A line is composed of a point and the two rays emerging from it. Theorem 6.15 of [Schwabhauser] p. 45.  (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 26-Oct-2013.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 19-Apr-2014.)
statement: lineunray $p |- ( ( N e. NN /\ ( P e. ( EE ` N ) /\ Q e. ( EE ` N ) /\ R e. ( EE ` N ) ) /\ ( P =/= Q /\ P =/= R ) ) -> ( P Btwn <. Q , R >. -> ( P Line Q ) = ( ( ( P Ray Q ) u. { P } ) u. ( P Ray R ) ) ) ) $.
